meanings.definition: To open or cause to open
meanings.sent2: The magician unclosed the box to reveal a rabbit.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat unclosed its eyes to see the sun shining.
meanings.sent4: His smile unclosed the sadness in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The key unclosing the treasure chest was finally found.

meanings.sent1: The unclosing window let in a cool breeze.
meanings.sent2: The unclosing umbrella protected her from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The unclosing gate creaked in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The unclosing book lay open on the table.

meanings.definition: The act of opening or becoming open
meanings.sent1: The unclosing of the flower petals was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: The unclosing of the curtains let in the morning light.
meanings.sent3: The unclosing of the gift box revealed a shiny necklace.
meanings.sent4: The unclosing of the door signaled the start of the party.
meanings.sent5: The unclosing of the clouds brought a rainbow.
